I absolutely recommend this movie, although it will (should) make you angry. We don't typically get to see the full story of how racial friction leads to tragedy, but that is what this film lays bare. It's frustrating and infuriating to watch this older woman rage against her neighbors for simply playing football and roller skating and being kids around her house - but people like her do exist, unfortunately.

The way the film was edited was incredible, considering that most of the video came from bodycam footage. Watching the police do what they can to help the situation within the limits of the law was interesting, and of course disappointing when they couldn't take greater action to discourage the "perfect neighbor" from her ridiculous behavior. What a miserable person! But it was worth watching to have a better understanding of how some community relationships develop and deteriorate around us.
